data.text:
Coming up shortly: the #ECBForum panel on central bank digital currencies and the digital euro project.
 
Watch live on our website https://t.co/k2MLroY4Xz https://t.co/VoExYU6s6o

Starting now: the #ECBForum continues with session 2 on energy price volatility and energy sources in Europe.

Follow live on our website https://t.co/k2MLroY4Xz https://t.co/i4hsZLOoId

Starting now: session 1 of the #ECBForum opens with a discussion on globalisation and labour markets in the post-pandemic economy.

Watch live on our website https://t.co/k2MLroY4Xz https://t.co/FEnnxDYDtb

Lagarde: To preserve our monetary policy transmission, we will start to apply flexibility in our PEPP reinvestments as of July 1.

Bond redemptions can be reinvested in Eurosystem jurisdictions where orderly transmission is at risk.

Read the full speech https://t.co/xLHaTe1NRD

The euro area is facing a complex mix of shocks which are reducing growth and pushing up inflation, says President Christine @Lagarde at the #ECBForum on Central Banking.
 
It is imperative for policymakers, within their mandates, to address the risks to the outlook
 
1/2
LIVE: President Christine @Lagarde opens day 2 of the #ECBForum on Central Banking https://t.co/wWoKRmmTG0
Follow live coverage of the #ECBForum here on Twitter from 10:00 CET as President Christine @Lagarde launches today’s proceedings. https://t.co/ondqXry2h1

Coming up shortly: the #ECBForum kicks off with London Business School professors @helene_rey and Richard Portes discussing threats to financial stability.

The conversation will be moderated by Executive Board member @Isabel_Schnabel.

Watch live https://t.co/k2MLroY4Xz https://t.co/blX99g4wag
Working Paper: The shifts and the shocks - Bank risk, leverage, and the macroeconomy https://t.co/41PMWQQhdg
Working Paper: A model of system-wide stress simulation: market-based finance and the Covid-19 event https://t.co/D3FLnvRT31

Today is the first day of the 2022 #ECBForum on Central Banking.

The focus of this year’s discussions is on monetary policy challenges in a rapidly changing world.

Follow the live this evening from 19:30 CET.

See the programme https://t.co/UvhTd5uruD https://t.co/hq9m5XBWFS
New times for ECB’s monetary policy decisions and press conference https://t.co/ANTS7HRj2h

Meet this year’s #ECBForum Young Economist Prize finalists!

They all submitted impressive papers on the challenges for monetary policy in a rapidly changing world.

Stay tuned for the announcement of the winner on Wednesday afternoon.

Learn more

https://t.co/pfedqyh8CZ https://t.co/7Mr5mnRNVw
Missed this year’s #SRBECB2022 conference? Find out more and watch the recorded sessions https://t.co/yGdh2J1OZs https://t.co/WlcmQx8JVX

This year’s #ECBForum on Central Banking will take place next week, from 27 to 29 June.

Discussions will focus on monetary policy challenges in a rapidly changing world.
 
The Forum will be webcast live – so check out the programme https://t.co/UvhTd5uruD https://t.co/wLYyreUxSv

Will banks be able to adapt their operations to handle what lies ahead? What can supervisors do to steer them in the right direction?
Tune in at 10:00 CET today to watch our panellists discuss these questions and more at the #SRBECB2022 conference https://t.co/yGdh2J1OZs https://t.co/iTpZQIt7V1

Coming up at 9:30 CET: day 2 of the #SRBECB2022 conference.

➡ Speech by @kbc_group CEO Johan Thijs
➡ Panel discussion on banks’ operational resilience 
➡ Speech by @SRB Chair Elke König 

Follow live here https://t.co/yGdh2J1OZs https://t.co/ZEU1e4svBg

What does the future of banking look like? And how will banks, supervisors and regulators need to adapt? 
Watch our livestream at 16:30 CET today to see our panellists discuss these questions and more at the #SRBECB2022 conference https://t.co/yGdh2IKdAS https://t.co/tDPz8gxTaT

What do the latest Eurogroup decisions mean for the future of the banking union? How can we further improve our crisis management strategies for banks? 
Tune in today at 15:00 CET to watch our panellists discuss this and more at the #SRBECB2022 conference https://t.co/yGdh2J1OZs https://t.co/WzBfnBhuZI

Enria: We cannot stand still as complex political negotiations on completing the banking union play out. That is why European banking supervision has proposed several ways to use the full potential of the legal and regulatory framework currently in place

2/2

🧵 At last week’s Eurogroup meeting, consensus on a roadmap to complete the banking union proved to be an elusive target, says Supervisory Board Chair Andrea Enria in his opening remarks at the joint #SRBECB2022 conference. 
Read the speech https://t.co/PhOhTsSPHy

1/2 https://t.co/oHkYGb46ip

The latest Economic Bulletin is out! 

The Bulletin presents the economic and monetary information which forms the basis for our policy decisions. 

Read more https://t.co/u8aM9YAV2y https://t.co/aszckmKwPu
Economic bulletin article: Firm debt financing structures and the transmission of shocks in the euro area https://t.co/VWGI2pbnqA
Economic bulletin box: Liquidity conditions and monetary policy operations from 9 February to 19 April 2022 https://t.co/2PWsaSUmKb
Economic bulletin box: The impact of the Russian invasion of Ukraine on euro area activity via the uncertainty channel https://t.co/zewDaOy3yY

Starting at 14:30 CET: day 1 of the #SRBECB2022 conference.

➡ Supervisory Board Chair Andrea Enria opens the conference
➡ Speech by Commissioner Mairead @McGuinnessEU
➡ Panel discussions on crisis management and the future of banking

Follow live here
https://t.co/yGdh2J1OZs https://t.co/NwFzk1KB3a
POLL: join in the conversation at this week’s #SRBECB2022 conference! What is the biggest challenge to the resilience of banks in Europe?

Forecasts by experts have also worsened since earlier this year.
But they still expect inflation to drop below 2% in the second half of 2023 and growth to remain above 2%. Although uncertainty is high, current forecasts do not point to stagflation

3/3

Euro area consumers have revised their expectations for the year ahead – up for inflation and down for the economic outlook – shows a survey by the @EU_Commission.

The recent revisions are comparable to those observed in some countries during the 1970s oil embargo

2/3

🧵The war in Ukraine has worsened existing supply chain disruptions and pushed inflation higher.

The uncertain economic outlook has also triggered a debate about stagflation, a period of high inflation and no growth https://t.co/9Tx4jW4i1R #EconomicBulletin

1/3 https://t.co/VEraXqjr1r

Firms expect increases in investment, input costs and prices during the green transition, but not so much later on, a survey shows. 
Availability of clean technologies will be a challenge, along with climate change risks https://t.co/HNKBAEd3q8 #EconomicBulletin https://t.co/3GdgZib9xU

Our climate risk stress test has a broad, for a large part qualitative scope, says Supervisory Board Vice-Chair @FrankElderson. The results will give us a clearer picture of how well banks can analyse, assess and respond to climate-related stress https://t.co/GSVQCdW3mm https://t.co/jbdNC7Lm3z

Follow live from 9:45 CET: Supervisory Board Vice-Chair @FrankElderson talks about the roles of banks and supervisors in tackling the climate and environmental crises https://t.co/z0qizdov8O https://t.co/OqACqlabpu

Also read about energy price developments in and out of the pandemic in an article covering:

➡️the relationship between gas and oil prices
➡️how commodity prices affect consumer prices
➡️developments in fuel prices

Read the article https://t.co/Uv1l8bph9r #EconomicBulletin

4/4

Pressures on consumers owing to energy prices remain high, but governments’ support measures have alleviated these somewhat

3/4

Energy markets in the euro area have been especially affected by the price spikes given their heavy reliance on Russian supplies, particularly of natural gas. EU countries are taking steps to reduce this dependence

2/4

🧵Oil, coal and gas prices spiked immediately after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. They have been volatile ever since due to disruptions to energy supplies and increasingly strict economic sanctions against Russia https://t.co/L7pHYPR6dU #EconomicBulletin

1/4 https://t.co/oer2auAVEA
Working Paper: Climate Change-Related Regulatory Risks and Bank Lending https://t.co/N111KGvwUZ
Occasional Paper: The macroeconomic and fiscal impact of population ageing https://t.co/g2hhBu4arf

The sharp rise in inflation is mainly due to higher imported food and energy prices. But our new measure of inflation suggests that domestic price pressures within the euro area also increased over the past year https://t.co/rAK197B8jT #EconomicBulletin https://t.co/WCYPOrVDAu

Food prices are an important contributor to inflation, given their importance in the consumption basket. 
Euro area food inflation is likely to remain high in the coming months on account of rising commodity and producer prices

3/3

While the European Union is largely self-sufficient in agricultural products, the food sector, particularly in some countries, is still partly dependent on imports of grain, oil seed and fertiliser from Ukraine, Russia and Belarus

2/3

🧵 Food inflation in the euro area reached a historical high in May 2022.

Rising global energy and commodity prices, further aggravated by Russia’s war in Ukraine, were the main factors behind this https://t.co/aCoEUqMVKe #EconomicBulletin

1/3 https://t.co/R3Sb6lci4U
Euro area monthly balance of payments (April 2022) https://t.co/fxVBoTmBwn

Register now and watch live from 8:15 CET today: Supervisory Board Chair Andrea Enria talks about our supervisory priorities to Andrea Filtri at the @mediobanca CEO Conference https://t.co/VJ9XpnX8Tq https://t.co/PooIzvVXHQ
President @Lagarde's introductory statement in charts https://t.co/sSBtrTn2j5
Introductory statement by President Christine @Lagarde at the hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament https://t.co/w0TBFYetyL

Lagarde: Moreover, we have pledged to act against resurgent fragmentation risks. The pandemic has left lasting vulnerabilities in the euro area economy which are contributing to the uneven transmission of the normalisation of our monetary policy.

Lagarde: High inflation is a challenge. That’s why we are taking further steps to normalise monetary policy by:

➡️ ending net asset purchases as of 1 July 
➡️ intending to raise our key interest rates at our July monetary policy meeting, and again in September

Lagarde: Inflation has risen further, reaching 8.1% in May, reflecting in part  the rise in energy and food prices. We have revised our projections significantly and see inflation remaining elevated for some time, declining towards our target in 2024. https://t.co/ZpRpLCFZvl

Lagarde: Euro area activity is being dampened by high energy costs, supply disruptions and greater uncertainty. At the same time, services activity is supporting growth, and the sector’s recovery is expected to strengthen over the coming months. https://t.co/nnY56Vj8ug

Live now: President @Lagarde speaks before the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the @Europarl_EN and answers questions from its members. 
Follow here https://t.co/Hef6JljFOF @EP_Economics https://t.co/r7mZTczSxa

Tune in at 15:00 CET to watch President Christine @Lagarde speak before the Economic and Monetary Affairs Committee of the @Europarl_EN and answer questions from its members. 
Follow the webcast here https://t.co/Hef6JljFOF  @EP_Economics https://t.co/FMyDA7Efa5

The arrival in the euro area of people fleeing the war in Ukraine could gradually boost the labour force by an additional 0.3 to 1.3 million workers. 
The actual figure will depend on how the war evolves https://t.co/CR6gQuhzZB #EconomicBulletin https://t.co/i6l3mCM8rr

The switch to the new euro short-term rate, €STR, was completed in January 2022. A smooth transition from EONIA to €STR as the overnight benchmark interest rate for the euro avoided risks to financial stability and monetary policy https://t.co/gIzNgozus1 #EconomicBulletin https://t.co/Vvj2imQSlp
Watch again: Executive Board member Fabio Panetta speaks at the @Europarl_EN Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs about why we need a digital euro. https://t.co/2xxqCkrEUg

Panetta: We are exploring the possible introduction of a digital euro and implementing our retail payments strategy.

We will step up our interaction with the private sector. 

Combining our strengths remains the best way to modern, efficient and inclusive European payments.

3/3

🧵To meet the new challenges we face, we need the same public-private cooperation that has been the hallmark of our success in building the European payments market over the last 20 years, says Executive Board member Fabio Panetta at @epc_sepa.
 
https://t.co/18L67wEn06 https://t.co/RzsQchFVpt

What is inflation, what does it have to do with the war in Ukraine and what can the ECB do about it?

Executive Board member @Isabel_Schnabel answered these and other questions from Amina and Leana in an interview for @Dein_Spiegel.

Read the interview https://t.co/sZ2HS8526Y https://t.co/pNBqrEWcpe

Fragmentation – or the impaired transmission of monetary policy – has always been a concern for us, says Vice-President Luis de Guindos. Markets should have no doubts about how determined we are to address this issue https://t.co/09vhqzjjgL https://t.co/sz45up4fwf

You can watch Executive Board member Fabio Panetta discussing the ongoing work on a digital euro at the European Parliament’s Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs @EP_Economics https://t.co/98ggEHbwLg https://t.co/GZxn1ejqMe

The #SRBECB2022 conference kicks off in a week’s time. 
The theme of this year’s event is “The test of time: banking union a decade on”. Watch it live on 23 and 24 June – check out the programme here https://t.co/yGdh2J1OZs https://t.co/xisJkgsHE9

Panetta: We will design the digital euro in a way that makes it attractive to users, who would like to use it to pay anywhere.

We will strive for the highest standards of privacy and aim to contribute to financial inclusion and foster digital innovation

4/4

Panetta: Having digital money issued by the central bank and available to everyone will avoid confusion about what digital money is and what it is not.

Unbacked crypto-assets, for example, cannot perform the functions of money, while stablecoins are vulnerable to runs

3/4

Panetta: We would pay close attention to financial stability and preserving a diverse and vibrant ecosystem, without impairing monetary policy transmission.

It is possible to design a digital euro with effective tools to prevent it from being used as a form of investment

2/4

🧵 A digital euro would respond to the demand for digitalisation and provide an anchor of stability in the world of digital finance, says Executive Board member Fabio Panetta.

Speech https://t.co/JvVkg9AAfq

1/4 https://t.co/gyCkArz1rK

Coming up at 15:15 CET: Executive Board member Fabio Panetta will speak about progress on the digital euro project at the European Parliament’s Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs @EP_Economics.

Follow live https://t.co/98ggEHbwLg
Press release: Statement after the ad hoc meeting of the ECB Governing Council https://t.co/RGKJon5Ndk

The #digitaleuro must meet European citizens’ needs while also addressing their concerns about privacy and financial exclusion. We spoke with civil society organisations about how to do this.

Watch here https://t.co/rRXtDg281Q https://t.co/QneLagLMQA
Research Bulletin: Europe’s growing league of small corporate bond issuers - new players, different game dynamics https://t.co/CfF1OU7v7Y

We won’t tolerate changes in financing conditions that are not fundamentally justified and that threaten monetary policy transmission, says @Isabel_Schnabel at @SorbonneParis1. By countering fragmentation, monetary policy contributes to European unity 
https://t.co/Nz9vvIXueW https://t.co/1HwmoirSVF

Banking and capital markets will have to help manage the investment needed for the green and digital transition, says Supervisory Board member Elizabeth McCaul. Securitisation could play an important role as a bridge between banks and capital markets https://t.co/spNVt6l5NV https://t.co/ZUmhU1LjOp

Explore detailed insights on:

1⃣the implications for the euro and the US dollar of Russia’s war in Ukraine 
2⃣the use of the euro as a financing currency across different sectors
3⃣the euro’s role in the global market for stablecoins

Read the report https://t.co/t72EwSkP4s

3/3

Looking ahead, the international role of the euro will be primarily supported by a deeper and more complete Economic and Monetary Union. This includes advancing the Capital Markets Union

2/3

🧵The international role of the euro is broadly stable and the euro remains the second most used currency globally. These are the main findings from our 2021 annual review.

Press release https://t.co/WoIP72slIx
Full report https://t.co/t72EwSkP4s

1/3 https://t.co/gf34OXhDUF

Supervisory Board Chair Andrea Enria welcomed a group of students from @LBS to our premises in Frankfurt yesterday. 
 
It was a great occasion to meet and exchange views with young academics. https://t.co/2FxsgZ69Ae

Do you have questions on inflation, climate change, the euro or any other topics? Head over to our Instagram and send us your question. Next week, Executive Board member @FrankElderson will answer some of your questions there! https://t.co/dNwTj7yQmr https://t.co/SNtIqZ2eIA
Opinion on the establishment and functioning of the European Single Access Point (ESAP) https://t.co/V8iaAwnWtp
The ECB Survey of Monetary Analysts - Aggregated Results (June 2022) https://t.co/R1HjKh1Jir

Elderson: Banks are well advised to identify harmful behavioural patterns and act upon them. As supervisors we can ask the right questions and challenge a bank to look further than governance in the stricter, more standard sense 
 
3/3

Elderson: A bank can have all the risk controls in place, the most advanced tools to manage risks, and rely on data of the highest quality, but if its internal culture is weak, it can still suffer severe reputational and other damage 
 
2/3

The behaviour and culture within a bank influence its decision-making, says Supervisory Board Vice-Chair @FrankElderson at @EUI_FBF_School. These aspects are important parts of a bank’s governance https://t.co/lHJninyoTg 

1/3 https://t.co/is87g3ri0i
Publication: TARGET Annual Report 2021 https://t.co/MQxsvIys1N
Transcript with Q&A of yesterday’s monetary policy press conference https://t.co/P4gF6ZQRp4 https://t.co/LG9fiq2XuA

Watch again: President @Lagarde on upcoming interest rate hikes.
 
Read more about what we decided today https://t.co/DaszhqakGD https://t.co/1PBbjwD7HO

Présidente @Lagarde sur les raisons du relèvement des taux d’intérêt.

Regardez l’intégralité de la conférence de presse ici https://t.co/1CsgQbdZzi https://t.co/3BLbU6x3Dx

Präsidentin @Lagarde dazu, warum wir die Zinsen erhöhen wollen.

Pressekonferenz ansehen https://t.co/1CsgQbdZzi https://t.co/0bXYB3tM9c

President @Lagarde over waarom we de rente gaan verhogen.

Bekijk de volledige persconferentie hier https://t.co/1CsgQbdZzi https://t.co/VeJLi1hvEF

La Presidente @Lagarde su perché intendiamo aumentare i tassi di interesse.

Guarda qui la versione integrale della conferenza stampa https://t.co/1CsgQbdZzi https://t.co/91LNlM719t

Presidenta @Lagarde sobre por qué prevemos subir los tipos de interés.

Vea la rueda de prensa completa aquí https://t.co/1CsgQbdZzi https://t.co/dpqoibD8ka

President @Lagarde on why we intend to raise interest rates.
 
Watch the full press conference here https://t.co/1CsgQbdZzi https://t.co/dBrnb5S1ZP
@Lagarde The episode is now also available on podlink https://t.co/YPq34CbhPp

We’ve just taken our latest monetary policy decisions, determining what’s needed to achieve stable prices in the euro area. 

Tune in to #TheECBPodcast to hear President Christine @Lagarde present the decisions in our press conference 
https://t.co/QFNypTpc1k

Today we took our latest monetary policy decisions:

🔵We will end net purchases under our asset purchase programme as of 1 July 2022

🔵We intend to raise our interest rates by 0.25% in July and expect to increase them again in September

More here https://t.co/DaszhqakGD https://t.co/0CITSD4Nza

Eurosystem staff macroeconomic projections for the euro area (June 2022)

https://t.co/OF0Ubjy9tL https://t.co/FxX79aWSgN
President Christine @Lagarde introduces the inflation outlook for the euro area https://t.co/wzeXkCawOX
President Christine @Lagarde introduces the economic growth outlook for the euro area https://t.co/9n3vErnIg5

President @Lagarde has just presented the Governing Council’s monetary policy statement.

Read the statement https://t.co/P4gF6ZQRp4
Watch the ECB press conference live: President Christine @Lagarde explains today’s monetary policy decisions @DNB_NL https://t.co/ZO0kZfflb5
Coming up in 15 minutes: watch live as President Christine @Lagarde explains the latest monetary policy decisions. https://t.co/ybf63UdHA6
